channel.title: [317] Login packet /something\

item.title: [317] Login packet /something\
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

Which class file does a 317 send out the login packet and byte?

in client i found this:

			fillInStream(loginPacketSize);
			if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 255 || inStream.readUnsignedWord() != 317) {
				shutdownError("Wrong login packet magic ID (expected 255, 317)");
				return;
			}

Where 317 is the client number and 255 is the packet? some one wanna correct me here?
How can I make it so the 255 part is X (x= any number I want it to be, so the server/client ASKS for number X instead of 255) and which file can I find it under?
I have been looking through the following classes:
client, playerhandler, server, stream, (also in cryption i found this:

  public int getNextKey()
    {
        if(keyArrayIdx-- == 0)
        {
            generateNextKeySet();
            keyArrayIdx = 255;
        }
        return keySetArray[keyArrayIdx];
    }

tho i found it has anything to do with what i’m looking for yes the 255 made me curious abou tthat )

Any one correct if I’m making a mistake or have incorrect info please?

Read full topic
